title: Can we reduce the slow on fizzes ult?
body:
He's already one of the most mobile champions in the game, does he really need a massive slow, knock up, damage enhancing, and damage dealing ultimate. 
If not remove the slow, atleast reduce it, he doesn't need a 70% slow on top of his 60% playful trickster slow.

replies.body: Slows don't stack (not for the last two seasons at least). If you get hit by a 70% slow and a 60% slow at the same time, only the 70% will apply.

> [{quoted}](name=dunkeroni,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=ZbiYkVUX,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-04-14T19:59:51.307+0000)
>
> Slows don't stack (not for the last two seasons at least). If you get hit by a 70% slow and a 60% slow at the same time, only the 70% will apply.

well yah, a 130% slow would be a stun.

Also wrong.

Previously they did stack multiplicatively, in which case if hit by a 60% slow and then a 70% slow, your speed would be reduced to 0.4*0.3 = 0.12, an 88% slow (if you don't have any tenacity).

Also your terminology is wrong as a stun stops you from casting any abilities or spells (except for cleanse, some spellshields, and QSS actives).  It's not even a snare, since you can still cast mobility spells like flash and any dash/warp.
Seems u are a smartass in school mate lmao

No, that's just how it works lmao

Multiplicative %'s isn't even something super academic, that shit is basic math bruh
I think he meant having 2 major slows in his kit, not stacking them to increase the intensity.
